SEARCH
Package Simulator

Class Robot

java.lang.Object
Simulator.Robot
public class Robot extends Object
A robot that can move around and deliver packages on a delivery map. The robot can recharge at its charging point and must return to it periodically to avoid running out of power.
Version:
1.0.0 20/04/2023 A robot's battery level must always be between 0 and 100. If a robot's battery level drops to 0, it must return to its charging point to recharge.
Author:
Jude Adam

  • Constructor Details

    • Robot

      public Robot(Point startingPoint, DeliveryMap deliveryMap, Random generator)
      Robot Constructor
      Parameters:
      startingPoint - the starting point of the robot
      deliveryMap - the delivery map that the robot will navigate through
      generator - the random number generator used to generate trajectory lengths

  • Method Details

    • getPowerState

      public RobotPowerState getPowerState()
      Returns the power state of the robot.
      Returns:
      the power state of the robot

    • subscribeToManager

      public void subscribeToManager(RobotManager manager)
      Subscribes the robot to a robot manager.
      Parameters:
      manager - the robot manager to subscribe to

    • getEnergy

      public double getEnergy()
      Returns:
      the current energy level of the robot

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the state of the robot. Depending on the robot's power state, this may involve moving to a new position, charging the battery, or updating the robot manager with its current state.

    • canReachDestination

      public boolean canReachDestination(Trajectory trajectory)
      Determines whether the robot can reach its destination given a trajectory.
      Parameters:
      trajectory - the trajectory to check
      Returns:
      true if the robot can reach its destination, false otherwise

    • canReachChargingStation

      public boolean canReachChargingStation()
      Determines whether the robot can reach the charging station from its current position without running out of energy.
      Returns:
      true if the robot can reach the charging station without running out of energy, false otherwise

    • setPath

      public void setPath(Trajectory trajectory)
      Sets the trajectory of the robot to the given one, and notifies the manager that the robot is delivering. This method also sets the power state of the robot to DELIVERING.
      Parameters:
      trajectory - the trajectory that the robot will follow

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Formats the robot's current position, energy level, power state, and whether it's delivering or returning to the charging station into a string representation. The * symbol is used to denote that the robot is delivering.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the robot

    • moveToNextPosition

      private void moveToNextPosition()
      Moves the robot to the next position in the trajectory. If the robot has reached its destination, it changes its power state to CHARGING if it was RETURNING, or to STANDBY if it was DELIVERING, and notifies the manager.

    • goToChargingStation

      private void goToChargingStation()
      Moves the robot to the next position in the trajectory. If the robot has reached its destination, it changes its power state to CHARGING if it was RETURNING, or to STANDBY if it was DELIVERING, and notifies the manager.

    • findTrajectory

      public Trajectory findTrajectory(Point start, Point destination)
      Finds a trajectory between the start and destination points using the provided planner.
      Parameters:
      start - the starting point of the trajectory
      destination - the destination point of the trajectory
      Returns:
      the trajectory between the start and destination points

    • getCurrentPosition

      public Point getCurrentPosition()
